casebody.data:
Consolidated Coal Company, of St. Louis, v. Joshua S. Peers and Adaline Peers.

This case follows the decision in Peers et al. v. Consolidated Coal Company of St. Louis. (See last preceding case.)

Charles W. Thomas, attorney for appellant.John G-. Irwin • and Wm. H. Krome, attorneys for appellees. Hr. Justice Green

delivered the opinion of the Court.

This is the case mentioned in the opinion in Joshua S. Peers et al. v. the Consolidated Coal Co., heard and decided at the February term, 1895, of this court (last preceding case). Both cases were heard together and the same question is involved in each. In the case at bar the finding and judgment went for appellees, and for the reasons given for reversing the judgment in the other case, this judgment is affirmed.
